posts.author: Illusion
posts.content:
Hello there, my name is Illusion. I have come for your help in a problem I have run into, as such I should go onto explain some things, before I go into anything I want to make, I should probably go into what's changed on the server I chose to play on (only one I could find, but it shall be good regardless)
  • A Level 30 server named Arelith.
  • Class changes are mostly none existence except sub-classes Bard gains warlock etc, but this is not my intent, though you can get gifts that do different things
  • It seems AA, BG, DC, DD, SD, and WM are free reign, the others require permission, as such I would like to remain in these if needed.
Now here comes the long part, I've played a warrior, mage, and that was all fun. But, I decided to take a route less traveled. I wanted to make a support character, I suppose I should go on, I wanted to make a bard, but wondered if a pure bard was a bad idea, now here are some bullets though I know somethings have a negative impact perhaps.
  • I wanted to make it a dwarf regardless of the current situation of it getting a -2 to its CHA.
  • I have no specific weapon in mind actually, so that itself would be free reign.
  • I wanted it to be capable of support, so I'm not looking for a solo major big number one shotting paladin. Some survivability solo would be nice, but it's majority, I would like to focus on buffing, (and if possible healing)
  • I did not know if leaving it a pure bard would be good or not, I've read the guides here and while informative, that multiple classes can be better than a pure one, this can sometimes be a rare case, not many people I see aren't wanting a power build.
Now whilst I said all that there are a few things I did want to say beforehand, they aren't really necessary to the character itself but,
  • I don't want a build handed to me, I may not know the ways of making one, but I'd rather be apart of making my character (if someone is willing to teach me all the better). Getting a build tossed at me is no fun in comparison to at least helping forge it myself.
  • I'm not looking for the Ultimate Build, as there is no such thing, I'm looking for help to create something with practical use in PvE, and PvP.
If I missed giving any information that is needed please tell me, and I look forward to discussing it with you all.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hello Illusion and welcome as an aspiring builder!
I hear you. You want a support character.
Bard is a good choice. Bards can do a lot of support. Actually bard is one of the best classes to make versatile POWER builds. When you use the same features for support, you get a very versatile and powerful support character.
Bards use the songs, skills and spells for party support. They can also be very powerful in combat, if you think that counts as support.

You want to build the character with some aid from us. You seem undecided if you want a pure bard or not. 16 bard levels is a sweet spot if you want most song value from your investment. 20 or 21 levels will give you LI for almost permanent song effect. 24 levels will give undispellable spells.

I suggest that you make a temporary attempt at a build, and then we can guide you further.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I will recommend that you focus on what you want the character to be able to do and how far bard can take that. Then we can see what other classes can bring to that build idea. Don't clutter it up now with all kind of thinking on "a liittle bit of this and some of that" from all kind of classes. If you want to learn, start with something simple. That also gives focus and makes the build sound.
Are you willing to try and make an attempt with pure bard, just to get the feel with the class? (nudge, nudge)
You want to max out song with as high perform as you can reasonably get. You want curse song and lasting inspiration. You want at least charisma 16 to be able to cast all spells. What spells to pick can wait for later. And then you have to make a decision between focus on strength or dexterity if you want any combat prowess at all. There are many skills to choose from and you don't have more than 4 + int modifier skillpoints per level, so you have to pick wisely, depending on what you want your character to be able to do. A high intelligence gives more skillpoints. Most bards I've seen have intelligence 14.

As for your questions:
Undispellable means that your character has a higher caster level than what can be touched with lesser dispel (level 14), dispel magic (level 19) and greater dispelling (level 24). Those are the weapons of bards, clerics and druids, so you are safe from them once you have caster level 24.
Mages also have the breach line of spells and MD. Indispellability is not a guarantee against those spells. MD works both as a powerful breach spell and a dispell spell. You would need a character with 49 caster levels to be immune to the dispel effect form MD of a level 40 dispeller. The toolkit item based MD on the other hand has dispeller level 17 and you should be safe from that with 26 caster levels. But you will not be safe from the breach effect of MD.

We may well end with 24 bard levels like you suggest, but let us not start with the end, shall we?

Now the ball is with you.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
To make a build, use pen and paper, or kamiryn's character build calculator (CBC), an EXCEL sheet that let you try different build approaches, and does the math for you.
To test the builds, there are modules you can download that give you the xp and items you want, so you can build the characters level by level without playing them to get xp. They usually have an "arena" where you can test your build vs various creatures. I have tested two such modules called "novice to epic character maker" and "pretty good character creator". You can download it all from neverwintervault.org

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
The best support action of the bard is the tremendous bonus a party gets from the bard song and curse song combination, especially with high level songs. We are talking about great alterations of AB and AC and manipulation of saves and skills for the party and the opposing mob. The song effects can not be dispelled or breached. You can even sing and remain stealthed.
Good party spells include GMW, haste and mass haste, improved invisibility and the ability buffs. There are also several utility spells. The bard healing spells are of limited value, potions are better when available.
The skillset benefits the bard in a great way. Several skills will also help a party. The Taunt skill will help the lower the AC of opponents and will benefit the whole party. Appraise and Persuade/Bluff are there for gold, and RP. Listen empowered by the amplify spell for scouting. Bards are good at identifying items, they have a high lore skill, even without taking any ranks, and can buff it with spells and song.
Bards are not specialized healers, but can as support character take the heal skill up in the 40s/50s with a high level song. That has some use to save fallen comrades with healing kits, when they are about to bleed to death (Death model with death at -10 hp).

A multiclass option for support bards is rogue, for extra thieving- and trapskills, skillpoints, and uncanny dodge + evasion.
Shadowdancer is also a great defensive alternative for stealth builds if you can get HIPS, to make you the last man standing.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey there, Illusion.

Bards take a little while to mature into a powerhouse, so that may be why you're having problems in your testing. They're very limited early on, but their growth from levels 13-16 is amazing. However, if you've never used one, there might be things that you simply aren't aware of that you character can do. I'd take Mick's advice on this. Try to cough up a Bard 26 / Fighter 4 with all 4 Fighter levels pre-epic or a Bard 24 / Fighter 6 with 4 Fighter levels pre-epic and we can go from there.
